dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City silhouette. Sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main title: Young Soul Rebels  Soul sounds and punk from 1977: Parliament: 'P. Funk Want To Get Funked Up' and X-Ray Spex: 'Identity'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DJ Voice-over. He welcomes the listeners to  'Station we funk... the Mother Ship  connection... dealers of funky music and  P.funk...' Credits over more of the DJ's upbeat patter: 'Soul Patrol on 107 FM... uncut funk  across London town...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DJ tells his listeners to  Come to the Crypt place/  and get some funk in your face...  before announcing a tune, The Blackbyrds: 'Rock Creek Par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtitle: London, June 1977 - the Queen's Silver Jubilee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue-black summer sky. City road sounds in the distance The quiet is broken by a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG BLACK MAN climbs over the Park fence, moves into  the bushes. He changes station on his radio cassette  recorder, tunes into Soul Patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG BLACK MAN presses the 'Record' button. The  station DJ announces Roy Ayers: 'Running Away', a song wi an upbeat tempo yet a downbeat lyric:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't love each other/ like we used to do...  Running away... Running away...  You don't do the things you used to do/  Running away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG BLACK MAN is not alone in the Park. MEN weave  slowly through the bushes. Leaves rustle, twigs crack.  Shadows and silhouettes. The YOUNG BLACK MAN rests agains a tree. Matches are struck. The flames come and go like  fireflies. The YOUNG BLACK MAN watches the movements.  Suddenly a white hand strokes the YOUNG BLACK MAN's arm. The WHITE MAN's voice is unnaturally quiet, edgy. It coul be seductive, it could be violent. It has a disguised  quality. The WHITE MAN reaches for the cassette player. H tries to turn down the volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a firm hand. What ya want? Don't  mess with the sounds, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it down mate, draws attention. Don't  want an audience.  The YOUNG BLACK MAN holds the cassette player away from t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it down 'ere, do yer? Come down 'ere  regular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE MAN snatches again at the cassette player, turn the radio down. The music stops but the 'Record' button i still depressed. The WHITE MAN pulls the YOUNG BLACK MAN  towards him in a rough movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I ain't seen you before. So  leggo ma han'... I ain't into no rough  stuff, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG BLACK MAN rests the cassette player on the grou He kneels, starts to rub at the WHITE MAN's crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, aren't yer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ya wanna get to know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot's yer name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name? You a policeman or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just being friendly, tell us yer name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you're one stubborn white bwoy. OK -  Terry. Friends call me T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, but the WHITE MAN turns violent. He grips T.J. by the neck. There's a brief and angry struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE MAN's hand grabs at the cassette recorder. The  WHITE MAN runs through the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground - TWO MEN making love, the WHITE MAN stumbl over them... He drops the cassette recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirate radio station, hidden round the back of a brok down car. At the back of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, a nineteen year old light-skinned youth and CAZ,  darker skinned and a bit older, are at the turntable.  CHRIS's face is reflected in a rotating record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minimal lighting reveals little of the room, but the  two DJs are clearly dressed soul-style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last bars of 'Running Away' play. CHRIS is at the  ready. He speaks into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally from the Players Association:  'I Like It' - out now on the Vanguard  label. This is Chris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Caz, coming to you live on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soul Patrol.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East London's most exclusive P. Funk  station... reminding you to boogie down  Club 7 tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight till late.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you there.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And may the funk be with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS spins in his chair towards CAZ. They clap hands in  air, pleased the session went well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ drives to the Park. CHRIS is laid back in passenger  seat.  CAZ pulls up sharply. The car headlamps light up a poster on the Park railings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A punk-graphic style ad for a 'Fuck the Jubilee' concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to the concert?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh leave it out. The only music they're  into is the 'livin-in-a-Babylon-me-no- have-no-nice-time' music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ smiles at the exaggerated Jamaican accent.  CHRIS relaxes, takes out a spliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUNK the Jubilee, now dat would be our  event!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. This is for punks an'  hippies. So why are we stoppin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might get a bit of air...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likely story... I'll see myself home  then... You are ba... ad!  CHRIS draws on the spliff. Then hands it to CAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MURDERER'S Point of View (POV)  CHRIS climbs out of the car, CAZ follows.  CHRIS heads off towards the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ walks into the Park. Like T.J. before him, he climbs the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small and intimate barbershop, like someone's front roo Images of famous black men on the wall - Muhammad Ali,  Martin Luther King - a hall of fame mixed in with the usu barbershop postcards and framed certificates.  A MIDDLE-AGED BLACK MAN and TWO BOYS wait their turn.  The BARBER cuts CHRIS's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ is in the background. He flicks through a soul magazi The cover: Britain's Soul Scene: The Good, The Bad and th Plastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, me can show you how to do a duck's arse.  BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man. I do the best duck's arse in Dalston!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOYS fall about laughing at the mention of 'duck's  arse'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ calls across to the BARBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Lloyd, can I turn up the juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, go on, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CAZ turns up the stereo, the BARBER holds a mirror to  show CHRIS the cut at the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, you're not bad at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blessed cheek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER BLACK MAN walks into the barbershop. He speaks  quietly and soberly so that the BOYS don't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLDER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See dem kill a black bwoy in the Park las'  night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIDDLE-AGED MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you say?  OLDER MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kill a bwoy in the Park las' night.  Man called James, Terry James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS turns in the chair, shocked at the news.  CAZ walks out of the barbershop as another MAN enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ walks to his car, he leans on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs into the driving seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests his head on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours down the windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS joins him in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it ain't right, but I keep  thinking it could've been me, ya know?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dyer know it was roun' that bit of  the park?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why else would T.J. be in the park for  fuck's sake?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like that. Caz. Christ,  I knew 'im as well yer know.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. Chris... T.J....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... T.J.... Fuck...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't 'aving it Chris. It ain't real. Not

dialogues.speaker: T.J.
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man says the filth 'ave been swarmin'  roun' the estate this morning' - askin'  questions. You didn't see 'im?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not last night. There was 'ardly anyone  there. I thought it was quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ drives into the car-park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS climbs out the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks round to the driver's side. The window is wound  down. CAZ stays in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So yer definitely not gonna come wiv us?  It doesn't 'ave to be today...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't stoppin' ya.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, we've got to get some steady money  in, mate. An' I've got to get my Mum off  my back. D'yer know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just send me yer autograph when ya sign  up wiv Metro.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Caz, I can't stop livin' my life coz  he's dead, can I?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest it, Chris. I'll see ya later.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where yer going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ makes some effort to pull himself round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go down and see Roland 'bout  some crisp new tunes. You wait... I'll  make tonight so damn funky even the white  boys'll shake a leg!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some 'ope. An' I thought I was the  dreamer.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow d'ya mean?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comin' to Metro for employment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both smile. CHRIS rests his hand briefly on CAZ's shoulde He heads off. CAZ drives towards the Exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imposing foyer, tall walls, elegant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS steels himself to go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working against the elegance of the foyer there is an  extraordinary display of Jubilee tat. A vast crown with  lights and a fountain dominates the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on the staircase that leads off the foyer there's a  cardboard cut-out of the Queen, complete with mechanical  waving arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS's colour and soul style stand out at Metro. There's compensatory cockiness to his step. He passes the SECURIT GUARDS to speak to JILL, the young white receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, can I help you?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'ope so. I'm 'ere to see Jeff. Jeff Kane,  Soul Show.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he expecting you?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he said to pass by. Me and 'im are  good mates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL knows he's blagging. That view is confirmed when JEF KANE passes through the foyer, acknowledging only herself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF makes to leave. CHRIS looks at JILL... she nods...  CHRIS pursues JEFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff Kane? Hi, Jeff. My name's Chris,  Chris Morgan. I'm a big fan of your show,  man... I wanted to talk to you about the  station's plans...'cos me and my partner  Caz, we'd like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF pats CHRIS's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Glad you like the show. It's good  to meet listeners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE wanders away. CHRIS catches at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't just a listener... We're DJs... We  run a club, we'd like to get more into  radio, yer know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Club DJs, radio DJs... not the same  thing. Do you know how many listeners  think they'd make DJs? Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF gestures for CHRIS to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're good. Anyway, you still play  clubs, don't ya?  JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less now. A few weeks ago I was booked at  some goddam club in Essex. They start  giving me this ten-per-cent black-entry  crap, otherwise, they say, their regulars  are gonna cause some trouble. I told them  to sit on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF gestures, CHRIS laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But bout us being on the radio...  JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send in a tape. Make it quality. Try Tony  Cortin first, then keep hammering on his  door. But I'll tell you something... an  hour of soul a week is an hour too much  for some. We got these patriotic  listeners out there, and they always ring.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought your show was doing well?  JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's doing great. That's what they can't  handle. But let me ask you something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JEFF speaks, a young black woman (TRACY) comes down th stairs towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do you play music for yourself - to  party - or for the listeners?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say at first, but me and my mate  Caz, we don't just do a club... we run a  station ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS takes TRACY in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. You're serious.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony's screaming for you upstairs.  JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta run. Send in that tape and keep  complaining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF holds up a clenched fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF KANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be down in twenty minutes if you want to  talk some more.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and TRACY smile at each other. JEFF hurries up the  stairs. CHRIS watches as TRACY follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FORENSICS MAN investigates the scene of the murder. He  hands a bag of potential evidence to a POLICEMAN. Police  radio sounds in the background.  The area around the scene of the murder has been cordoned off with tape.  CAZ walks into the Park, carrying a Contempo Records  carrier bag.  The POLICE continue their work, they dismantle a cloth  screen.  Two MIDDLE-AGED BLACK WOMEN walk towards the scene of the murder.  A POLICEMAN lifts the tape to allow the WOMEN to duck und They lay wreaths by the tree where T.J. was killed.  The WOMEN cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN eyes CAZ suspiciously. CAZ catches the glance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY walks down the stairs towards CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen you before... Maunkberry's.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Global Village. Lacy's? Gullivers  maybe? Or is it Saturday lunchtime down  the 100? I've seen you somewhere, I know  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doing down here, apart  from harassing poor Jeff and making  Security nervous? Most DJs run a mile  when a fan turns up... Jeff's fighting to  keep the Soul Show running and along  comes you saying you want your own soul  show. I think he was pretty polite  considering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS ducks back, as if fending off the blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, cool... I'll split, yeah? Listen,  'ow did you get to work for him anyhow?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. I wouldn't mind. I'm on the 'In  Town Tonight' show - PA to the producer.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'In Town Tonight' show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS unfolds a piece of paper from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's in town -- where  those in the know go - those who tune  into Radio Soul Patrol! TRACY chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soul Patrol?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 FM. It's badly funky! I'll leave your  name at the door.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS has performed the patter and chat-up line, now he  makes to go. TRACY calls him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll leave a name at the door?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure!  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what is it?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame!  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy! Plus one... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS smiles. He and TRACY part, CHRIS breezes past the  SECURITY GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS walks across the Park. He keeps to the paths. There is an unease about him. The Park, the scene of the murder now the site of everyday park pleasures. A JOGGER pounds  past CHRIS, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS passes a POLICEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS finds his nine year old sister, TRISH. She's with t of her FRIENDS. They're some way from where the murder to place. A quick hug for CHRIS from TRISH. She and her  friends seem pleased to be talking to a 'big boy'. TRISH  jumps to touch the new haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watcha, baldie!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Trish? What yer doin' round 'ere?  TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police wouldn't let us play over there.  Bloke got killed.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH turns to her FRIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bruwa's a soul boy, and I'm a soul  girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH breaks into her soul girl routine. She has obviousl practised. She half-hums, half-sings as she dances. They  sing and dance to El Coco: 'Let's Get It Together'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH stops the dance and takes CHRIS to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will yer show us the formation dance? I  wanna show my mates, but it's too 'ard. I  can't rememba it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dance yeah? An' that's it. Mum'll  kill me, lettin' you 'ang about 'ere.  Ready? One...two...three... four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three girls fall into line as CHRIS turns, kicks and  steps. Neat, precise movements. The girls are good. The actual song over the girls' legs as they do a formati soul dance step. Finally TRISH breaks off, runs to the  nearby bushes.  TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got something to show yer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a battered radio cassette recorder, T.J.'s.  Left in the murderer's panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two. ..three...four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH holds the cassette player for CHRIS to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame this is broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks it over. Unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where d' ya get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it... Can yer sell it for us?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno... it looks well broke.  TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll check it. Come on girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to leave the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, carrying the cassette player, is followed by TRISH and the girls. They're still dancing to 'Let's Get It  Together'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Trish, I'll see ya back at the yard.  Yer dinner'll be ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS dance away. CHRIS walks on alone. He passes a  National Front slogan, painted on a railway arch wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS bangs his fist hard against the wall. The MURDERER (seen only from the back) watches as CHRIS  ducks under the bridge... walks on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage, site of the night-time pirate radio, now seen more fully in the daytime. A large room, a certain grande to it. It's almost a shrine to reggae/roots/rasta. Red,  green, gold... in clothes, on album covers and posters.  There's a boxing punch-bag suspended from the ceiling and rough and ready shower area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battery of homemade speakers, loose wires, valves and a throbbing sound - reggae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON, Caz's brother, works on an engine in the middle the room, his overalls dirty with grease. As CHRIS enters, DAVIS, a young black man, wraps a small  parcel. He pulls out a betting slip to do the job. His  customer is a young, white punk, later identified as  BILLIBUDD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, nice gaff you got 'ere... You got  any wiz?  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No suh! We don deal in chemicals. BILLIBUDD watches as CHRIS crosses from CARLTON to DAVIS, touching hands in greeting. CHRIS waits for BILLIBUDD to  leave before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 'eard about the murder in the Park? DAVIS kisses his teeth. He clearly doesn't want to talk  about it. CHRIS glances at BILLIBUDD.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's Johnny Rotten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD leaves the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a three pound draw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS pulls out a plastic bag full of weed from his jacke and another betting slip. He sprinkles a cluster of weed  onto the slip before folding it up and handing it to CHRI CHRIS takes it in one hand, puts it to his nose and smell it. With the other hand he pays over three pound notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go easy on the draw ya know Chris, min'  it don' lick aff ye 'ead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS takes out the packet of drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute, don' be in no haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS hands the weed to CHRIS and takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of Caz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only see dat brudda o' mine when 'e wants  something... CHRIS tests the cassette recorder from the park. It seems to be broken. He flips out the tape and crosses to the  garage tapedeck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out the reggae tape, plays the tape from the par He's excited to find the tape is of his and Caz's Soul  Patrol station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tape: Roy Ayers: 'Running Away'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that man! Soul Patrol!  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tek aff dat pretty bwoy music, man. Unna  Soul bwoy! Ye wanna fling aff dem earring  an' tune into the roots man, ye no see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bwoy, rest yerself. You're only into the  roots 'cos you can't dance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laughter increases as DAVIS turns up the cassette and dances to the music. It's a fast and furious dance, a  satire on the Soul Boy style. DAVIS gets wilder in the  parody, he's ready to end with a spot spin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spin stops halfway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO UNIFORMED POLICEMEN and a CID MAN walk in on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CID MAN switches the cassette player off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, oi... leave the tunes ..  CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ask you for come in here? They ignore the question. The UNIFORMED POLICEMEN rifle t shelves in the garage, knock things about, upturn boxes,  twist aerials and topple spare parts for cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose premises?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine. So what ya sayin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence James. Friend of yours, wasn't  he? He's been murdered.  CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard. So what ya gettin' at?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere near the Park last night?  Dealing were you?  CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of fuckeries you talkin' about?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well since he was supposed to be your  mate, thought you might have some ideas  about it.  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when you interested in our ideas  eh? Eh? But as you say you is why don't  you go and check your skinhead friends  first?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to DAVIS)  True. Since when Babylon cared inna black  man murder?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it son. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CID Man and the POLICEMEN leave as abruptly as they  arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON punches the punch-bag in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ is stretched out on Chris's bed. He looks intense,  absorbed. He swigs whisky from a bottle. Jean Carn: 'Don't Let It Go To Your Head' on the stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS comes in.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last place I thought I'd find you!  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya Mum let me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS sits down beside him, notices the half-empty bottle but says nothing about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filth were round the garage. Makin'  enquiries an' generally kickin' the place  in. An' your bruwa wants us out. Come to  think about it, it's not safe now anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS picks up the Contempo record bag. Tips it up, looks through the records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, yer got them new tunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... So what time you on Metro then?  Wiv you gone so long, took it they'd  given you a programme on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it was a waste of time, jus' like  you said. I spoke to Jeff Kane though... Great, you got the new Slave...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mnnn... mnnn...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I made myself look a right wally.  Does that satisfy yer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You actually met Jeff Kane?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the man 'imself. Hey, is that the  new Benson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. What'd he say?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said an hour a week of soul is an hour  too much for some - for a starter. Lots  of people go and see him, not so many  pirates though, Tracy was sayin'... Donna  Summer?!  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very latest. I 'ad to fight 'alf the  gay disco DJs to get that one. So who is  Tracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS selects a record to play. He looks at one of the ne ones, it's in a blank, white sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow come there's nothin' on this label?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a rejects, ain't it? All the big  labels are binning the records now -  well, they can't get the black bands on  tele, so they can't be bothered to  promote 'em.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if they try though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS half-dances to the new record. He still has some of the others in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So what else 'ave we? Right, you got  the new Parliament, what about the Philly  stuff?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't keep shelling out, can I Chris?  We're gonna have to get some  advertisin'... CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried that before. What we need is new  listeners, a bigger radius.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, betta aerial, it's the only way.  I'll 'ave a word wiv Ken.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? An' 'ow we gonna pay for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ rubs his hands together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ave to sell my body!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can see you down the Dilly, wiv  yer 'Sex' trousers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN and a WOMAN unfurl a large Union Jack. They drape it over the railings of a second-floor outside balcony. The beginnings or the estate courtyard's Jubilee decoration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS searches for a cassette. CAZ is seated on the bed  absorbed in a 'Black Music' magazine.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that where it is, in the box?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mnn... yup... yup... ANN, Chris's mother, a white woman in her thirties, puts  her head round the door. She looks to be halfway through  getting ready for a night out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Lo Caz. CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN looks to CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So 'ow did yer get on?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Mum.  ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yer went, didn't yer? What did he  apply for Caz?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Mum, yer don't exactly apply. Like I  said, can you forget it please? It's a  joke tryin' there, ain't it Caz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ refuses to be drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, an' it ain't a joke playing at  bloody pirates? Chris, when are you gonna  bring some respectable money into this  house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS silently mimics her, it's a speech he's heard befor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm absolutely sick of it... Anyway, get  off yer backside and take Trish round to  Caz's Mum's. I don't want her out on her  own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You out on the town again? Aren't yer  gettin a bit past it? ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cheeky bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't argue wiv that, can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN grabs CHRIS by the ear.  ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't too big for a clip round the  ear, you know Chris. You got one of them  funny cigarettes for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mums don't smoke weed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smoke it if they pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN smacks the side of CHRIS's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' if you touch my catalogue money  again...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Mum, alright! There yer go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS passes her a spliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll  run Trish over to  Mum's for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN sits and leans towards CAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Caz.... I didn't say anything  earlier. Well, what can yer say? I'm  sorry about Terry. Friend of yours,  wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just knew him around. Not close. But  thanks anyway Ann. Is Trish ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don' say nuffin to her, will yer?  Bout the park. She knows somebody's dead,  but I think that's all she knows. Ow you  s'posed to explain it to a kid? Can't  even explain the bastards to meself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a week since Shuresh's sister  got attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH shouts from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum. I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Anyhow, gotta go home and get  changed. Gotta get sexy for tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ leaves. ANN slaps CHRIS's leg to demand attention. Sh holds up the spliff for him to light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY, a white boy, heavily tattooed, wearing full skinh gear, hangs round the estate. Paint smears on his clothes and a spray can jutting from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get to the car, CAZ and TRISH have to pass him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, soulhead, where's yer boyfr... oops,  children present, where's yer friend  then?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't change, do ya Sparky? Always was a  little slimebag at school, now you're a  bigger one.  SPARKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My feelings is really hurt now Caz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ opens the car door for TRISH to get in. He turns  directly to SPARKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well be thankful it's only yer  feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 INT. CHRIS's FLAT - EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Henderson:'Say You Will' on the stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is stretched out, trying to push himself into a pai of tight, black leather trousers. He tugs the zip. They'r at least two sizes too small.  Later: CHRIS has changed his mind... he zips up red leath trousers. He's happier with the effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls on tight cowboy boots, but decides against...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ, in a fresh outfit, returns from dropping TRISH off. SPARKY has been joined by two mates, BIGGS and KELLY. KEL is a mixed-race skinhead. As CAZ's car pulls into the courtyard the gang hover roun half-blocking CAZ's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot you up to these days, Caz? We 'eard  something bout some poncy little radio  for all yer little soulboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BIGGSY speaks, KEN, a handsome if slightly going-to-se man, aged about thirty, appears in the shed area, in the  background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret list'ner Biggsy? You used to be  into it, didn't ya?  BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, you wanna watch yerself, soulie.  Uwerwise yer might find yerself arrested  for one fing or the other..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ notices KEN and moves to speak to him. Away from the  gang. CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a minute Ken? Wanted a word...  That mixer ya got us.  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what about it?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's duff... KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yer jokin? Look, tell yer what. I'll  come and 'ave a look at it. If I can't  fix it I'll find yer something else.  Something better this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap! I ain't linin' yer pockets again,  Ken. Specially if ya spending it on  shirts like that!... Sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ touches KEN's shirt with a gesture of distaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah... forget the mixer. I'm afta a betta  aerial, bigger radius. An A.H.? KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do for yer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 INT. CHRIS's FLAT - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stereo the end of Eddie Henderson: 'Say You Will'. CHRIS dances to the music, he's still getting ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ appears at the doorway. Unnoticed he watches CHRIS  dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ enjoys the sight of CHRIS changing, the successive  revealing and concealing of flesh as CHRIS tries to settl on a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting thinner...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's all the 'ard work.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've noticed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ nods approval at the final selection of shirt. CHRIS  checks out his overall look in the mirror. He's satisfied

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 EXT. ESTATE BALCONY (overlooking courtyard) - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and CHRIS haul records out onto the balcony. They sto to briefly hug. Part of the building up for the night.  They're off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as CAZ and CHRIS head for the car, the gang is again evidence. BIGGSY is perched on Caz's car bonnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS hits BIGGSY with a record case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, off the metallic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIGGSY slides off the bonnet, KELLY plays suggestively wi the car aerial.  KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna play wiv yer aerial!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS hits KELLY with the record case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, watch the cloth, moth!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit wound up, aren't we? Wot you need is  a party, Chris. Comin' to our little  Jubilee get togewer? You could wear your  white suit, an' I'll wear mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS speaks in mock East End white...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought that was your style Sparky, my  son. A big hood to hide yer ugly face, an'  slits for yer nasty little eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS has to push his way to the car, knocking BIGGSY asi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh steady, rocky...  CHRIS joins CAZ in the car.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a lug of that... nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ hands a spliff to CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CAZ pulls out of the estate, the gang make various  obscene, trouser-drop style gestures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ reverses sharply to make them jump out of the way. CA remains cool throughout. CAZ puts a tape on the car  cassette. The Blackbyrds: 'Time Is Moving On'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think they 'ad anything to do  wiv the murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it out, just the usual windin' us  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS isn't totally convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer neva can tell wiv Biggsy's lot. CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but if'e has had anything to do wiv  it, I'll break his fucking neck.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell ya, did I? I had a word wiv  Ken about the A.H. He's on the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slap hands, back to the mood of anticipation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A club in the crypt of a church. The odd tomb and engrave stone plaque remains, and the arches allow for small,  disparate groups to appear in, then disappear from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a young, mixed crowd, 50% black, 50% white. Mixed ga and straight, male and female, punk and soul. Most of the white crowd are punks. The punks stand round the edges li clumps of decaying flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and CHRIS move towards a raised altar-like platform.  Two female PUNK DJs are behind the decks, playing X-Ray  Spex: 'Oh Bondage Up Yours', a strong punk dance number:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punks pogo furiously on the dance-floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a bit of banter between CHRIS, CAZ and the punk  DJs as CAZ sets up a second table, ready to fadeout the  X-Ray Spex. CHRIS digs through his record collection. He  selects The Players Association: 'I Like It?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Chris...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Caz.  CHRIS and CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soul Patrol.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it, 'I Like It' ...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Players Association.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Players Association: 'I Like It' draws the soul crowd from behind the stone pillars to the dance-floor. Some of the punks move away, others shift into the soul-dancing,  an altogether more engaged and stylish dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the record continues, the floor fills. The dancing is  close. The unique and extraordinary mix of the seventies' soul clubs emerges - girls dance with girls, boys with  boys, girls with boys, punk with soul, black with white.. A long, held view of the dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and CAZ touch hands as they see the crowd get down. They're at their closest in creating the club atmosphere. People join in and add to the music - with whistles,  tambourines and shouted 'whoop/whoop' sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY and JILL from Metro Radio arrive, unseen by Chris.  They stand at the edge of the dancefloor. TRACY looks a  little out of place here, her South Molton Street style  too upmarket for this crowd. She is a bit older, a bit  classier, less street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL might be the right class, but her clothes are marked high-street. She openly stares at the clubgoers, it's cle she hasn't been to a club like it. JILL and TRACY knock  back their fist drinks. JILL, in for a penny attitude,  pulls TRACY to the dancefloor. CHRIS sees the two women making their way through the  dancers, finding a space. TRACY edges their dance towards the DJ rostrum. Towards CHRIS. CHRIS goes down to meet  them, without saying a word to CAZ. He dances alone at first, he's a good, vain, self-absorbe dancer. He dances alone till he knows TRACY'S attention i firmly on him. He then breaks the pose and steers himself close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ watches as the trio of CHRIS, JILL and TRACY forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks across to CAZ at the deck, breaks from the  dance. TRACY continues to dance with JILL, but watches as CHRIS rejoins CAZ at the deck. CAZ and TRACY exchange loo JILL is distracted by styles and colours, ears pierced wi multiple ear-rings, 'granny shoes', tight jeans, baggy  trousers tightened at the ankles, plastic sandals, cowboy boots, pointed shoes, collarless shirts, ripped fish-net  stockings, jackets made out of plastic bags, maxi-skirts, mini-skirts... and that's just the soul crowd! A PUNK the catches her attention, he wears a pair of Union Jack brie tacked to his jacket. He notices as she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY tries to smile at CHRIS, but CAZ is in the way, and when he's with CAZ, CHRIS seems to be avoiding her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK BOY, his hair dyed blond, wearing a very thick,  purple mohair jumper, dances up to TRACY. She accepts the unspoken invitation to dance. Though the dance involves  holding hands, there is a distance between them. JILL jum around with THE UNDERPANT PUNK, sending him and his dance style up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pattern on the dancefloor changes. People form two  circles. In the first - two black boys and a white boy. I the second - a black boy and black girl. We lose sight of JILL and TRACY. CHRIS and CAZ sort through their records, CHRIS keeps an eye open for TRACY. It's a while before he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ya see that girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one I was dancin' with. Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one I was tellin' ya about...  works at Metro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's well out of your league. What ya  ask her down 'ere for?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I object to your friends comin' down 'ere?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Na. Nice to be liberated, ain't it?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Caz, I didn't mean it like that.  Hey... What ya sayin'?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rum and coke, large!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ fades out The Players Association, fades in: Funkadel 'One Nation Under A Groove'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS leaves CAZ at the turntable. CHRIS pushes through t dancers, disappointed not to see TRACY. Quite close to th DJ platform there's a small group of PUNKS. BILLIBUDD, th punk who tried to score at the garage, is one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI has his eyes fixed on CAZ. CAZ notices the cruisy  stare and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS sees JILL and the PUNK, he laughs as she interrogat the soft-spoken, middle-class, art-school boy. JILL knock back the drink. She nods at CHRIS but her attention is on the two men behind him - the men are kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS finds TRACY. She's talking to the PUNK DJs. He  hovers, waiting for a chance to speak to her alone. KEN,  the equipment dealer, bumps into CHRIS. KEN looks out of  place in the club, he's more an East End pub disco type. manages to slop beer onto CHRIS's shirt in the crush near the makeshift bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Ken! Watch it wiv the drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY notices the drink incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Sorry... Thought I'd come and  check the club... spoke to Caz 'bout the  aerial today... I'm working on it. Look,  let me get you a drink...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, Ken... No...  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, yer busy ?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is clearly annoyed about the shirt, and he wants to be on his own with TRACY. KEN gets the message and leaves CHRIS turns to face TRACY.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting 'em in. Tracy. Do you want a  drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY holds up her full glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got one thanks... It's a bit mad in  here, nice though!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, listen Tracy, gimme a shout before  you leave, yeah?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to join us?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gettin' one in for Caz. I'll see you  afta, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS smiles and leaves, pushing through to the bar.  Everybody knows him. He turns down the gestured 'Let's  dance' from two guys doing the bump at the edge of the  dancefloor. DISSOLVE: To much later in the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL and TRACY are well plastered. JILL tries to avoid th now rather pressing attentions of the PUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steers TRACY into a quiet corridor, away from the  dancefloor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you like?... So what do you  think of the Crypt then Jill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good. I've never been to a  coloured... a black club before. Not to  mention one wiv blokes kissin' in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only fashion, Jill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only kidding... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL laughs.  JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what Trace, when you first  started at Metro I thought you was a bit  of a snob... but we've 'ad a good laugh,  ain't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, seeking TRACY out, interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, Tracy..... So what you hidin' from,  eh?  JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A punk in red, white and blue underpants!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, you 'ad his trousers off?  JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! They was on the back of his jacket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move back towards the dancefloor, laughing. But CHRI clearly wants to talk to TRACY, JILL is a bit in the way. She registers the fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I can see when I'm not wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PUNK places his arm round JILL's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUNK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, get dancing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into the dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later: CHRIS and TRACY in mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  I  don't know...  I want to extend  it to clubs.  What's really happening.  They've got no idea at Metro. The  programme is dead.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... so what you suggestin' then?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm suggesting that you make up a tape,  and leave the introductions to me.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick of being a PA I want to make  some changes Chris. Are you interested?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you bet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER IN THE EVENING. CHRIS at the decks. JILL and TRACY  dancing together, JILL getting a bit out of order,  enjoying herself hugely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ is by the bar. He talks to IRVINE, a young black man. IRVINE is dressed in red, skin-tight jeans with see-throu plastic pockets and a bright green top. In spite of being very much dressed for the club, he's visibly low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they talk KEN passes by. CAZ ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's jus' the thought of T.J. lyin'  there... That boy could really dance...  IRVINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think about it, girl, don't do no good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ laughs at the 'girl'. He looks over to a fairly quiet dancefloor, then up to CHRIS. CHRIS catches the look.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CHRIS changing the record to the fast and funky sound of  War: 'Me and My Baby Brother'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of dancers, predominantly black, forms. They bump  with shoulders, hands, hips, groins - the speakers  tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and IRVINE join the dance. They give the dance  everything they've got... an undefeated, controlled yet  wild dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and CHRIS carry record cases through the churchyard t the nearby sidestreet. They pass TWO PUNK WOMEN kissing.  Jill's UNDERPANT PUNK sits looking startling and miserabl on a tombstone. Most of the club crowd have gone. They're still half dancing as they pack up for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that was... Soul Patrol... Soul  Patrol ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a cool night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Listen Caz. I wanna make a tape  up, somebody asked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you up to now Chris?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'... Jus' need a few of the records.  Some of the imports. I'll get the last  lot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS goes back to fetch the rest of the records. CAZ kno he's up to something, and he's annoyed about it. A COUPLE of MEN stagger up to the car.  MAN 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd yer get the motor, man?  MAN 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that car, man! CAZ jumps in the car and drives off. CHRIS is stranded wi four boxes of records.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz! Where are you? Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY is parked across the road, she laughs at his burst temper. CHRIS steps to the car, leans in at the open wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with your friend?... Need a lift?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz has got the 'ump. Can I put the  records in the boot?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... Nice car...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY gets out, opens the boot. CHRIS puts the records in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's yer mate, Jill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing it with that punk!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah!  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lean against the boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where to?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy... Can I trust yer?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you in the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS gets in the passenger seat. TRACY drives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torchlight. Searching the cluttered shelves. The light  rests on T.J.'s cassette player where CHRIS left it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloved hand of the intruder grabs the cassette player

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ drives. On the car cassette: Dr Buzzard: 'I'll Play t Fool'. A crossover song, a mix of soul and disco, with  elements of the big band dance sound.  meet a guy/ain't it funny.../  keep on dancing... keep on dancing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He halts at a set of traffic lights. In the car alongside BILLIBUDD - the punk from the garage and the club. CAZ an BILLIBUDD exchange glances.  The lights change. BILLI changes lane, pulls ahead...  CAZ's car eventually following BILLIBUDD's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 EXT. EDGE of PARK - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD locks the door on his car, he looks round to se if he has been followed. He climbs the fence, moves into  the Park. CAZ drives to the edge of the Park, pulls up behind  BILLIBUDD's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY and CHRIS stumble through the garage in the dark.  They're laughing, a bit drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's not much to it, is there?  Through here?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it reminds me... I used to listen to  Caroline a lot... I even remember Radio 390, the R & B show.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dates you.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY knocks the punch-bag at CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS leads her through the broken down car, into the  hidden pirate radio base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy having a radio station at the back  of a garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they're through to the base, CHRIS seems awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, er... would you like to... are you  going to... you could stay you know  and... save me...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, here? No chance! You're joking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. CHRIS is all for going further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I've got work in the morning. And  you're gonna make me a tape, remember?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Right... Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ listens, there is a man following him. CAZ is near the murder spot. There is little light. The  footsteps are unnerving. Something of the tension of the  opening scene... But it is BILLIBUDD who follows him. The turn to face each other. BILLIBUDD untucks CAZ's top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pick your places, don't ya? You heard  what happened? BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya like living dangerously? BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna show the bastards - I ain't  stoppin' comin' 'ere. Brought this with  me. Get them in the eyes if there's any  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD brings out a small anti-perspirant spray can. C laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any good trouble and ya'll smell nice  afta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI laughs. He presses the spray, in play. BILLIBUDD  moves to kiss CAZ. To get into his trousers. CAZ is still on edge.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, not now. Not here... it feels a  bit weird. Give us yer number. BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... I've heard that before.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it feels a bit weird... Give us your  number... I mean it.... I mean it...  BILLI takes out a felt tip, he lifts up his t-shirt.... BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your number. Write it here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ writes his number across Billi's bare chest....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of a MAN in a telephone booth. The MAN disguises his voice, muffles it.  MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... I was there... he mugged him.  His name's Chris Morgan. I think he lives  on the Ladywell... No - I can't give  my... no names... right?... No... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN slams the phone down. At the MAN's feet - T.J.'s radio/cassette recorder. He  picks it up, leaves the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS runs the tap of a makeshift shower. He sticks his  head under it. He notices the big beer stain on his shirt He takes the shirt off, tries to get the stain out with  soap. It won't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He curses and returns to the deck. He works fast, by  lamplight, to compile a tape. He links the songs with a  DJ's patter. He listens to part of the tape, already  finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncut funk at he bop... coming to you  directly from the Mother Ship... on top  of the chocolate Milky Way... five  hundred thousand kilowatts of P Funk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's dedicated to all you East  London funketeers out there,  Parliament... P. Funk... we funk, you've  got the funk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parliament: 'P. Funk Wants To Get Funked Up' plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: CHRIS reaches for a fag, but he's out. He seems  stuck for an idea. Finally he remembers the tape his sist gave him. He looks across to where he left the cassette  recorder. He notices it has been moved, he's not unduly  concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took the tape out, he has it. He plays the park tape,  lets it run beyond the song: 'Running Away'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the WHITE MAN (MURDERER's VOICE) can be heard,  albeit a bit muffled and crackly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it down 'ere, do yer? Come down 'ere  regular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I ain't seen you before. So  leggo ma han'... I ain't into no rough  stuff, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 EXT. ESTATE - Shed/Dustbin area - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.'s radio cassette player burning, melting on a pile o rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, exhausted, lies back on a car seat. He runs his hands over his chest, over the crotch of his  jeans. There's someone watching, unnoticed. We see CHRIS  touching himself from an unidentified POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A milk lorry passes the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN'S gloved hand. A tense, stealthy movement of the MA through the garage.... CHRIS's feet protrude from the  backseat of the winched up car. He's fast asleep. The MAN head is covered with a metal mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloved hand grabs at Chris's feet, making him jump... But the hand is DAVIS's the gloves, work gloves. The mask for car repair/welding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.... Jes.... Davis....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yow! Check dis brudda boot nuh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS has arrived for work, CARLTON follows him in. CARLT stares at CHRIS'S footwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we 'ave here?.... Daggers? Hey bwoy,  min' you don' kick me wi yo daggers, ye  hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is not in the mood, he looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... Sh...it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs out past the bemused CARLTON and DAVIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the tube CHRIS has to push past FIVE POLITICOS. A yout has his back to CHRIS, his leather jacket bears a painted 'Anarchy in the UK' slogan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The youth turns round, his front lapel is covered in  badges... like a noticeboard for the left of 1977. It's  BILLIBUDD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS half-recognises him from the garage. He catches hol of BILLIBUDD'S lapel, peers at the badges: various  distorted images of the Royal Family, Mary Whitehouse wit 'Gay News Fights On' across her features, Punk badges,  Grunwick support, Stuff the Jubilee... But CHRIS takes  issue with one badge in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So disco sucks, does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindless, capitalist crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And punk's not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends how you use it. Don't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands CHRIS a 'Fuck the Jubilee' concert flyer. A list of bands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be something there you could dance  to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD is provoking/flirting, looking CHRIS over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpin' up and down like my arse is on  fire. BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no... We've got reggae bands  billed. Look, Misty and Roots, you'd like  that, wouldn'd yer?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)  Oh Wow! Look... I'm in a rush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ASIAN PUNK GIRL interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASIAN PUNK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't there more important things to talk  about fo' fuck's sake. Like this for  instance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to read from a leaflet, a list of recent racis attacks in the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASIAN PUNK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like two Somalis burnt to death, arson.  Like flats doors kicked in, windows  broke. Like Bengali schoolkids getting  their faces kicked in. Join a picket  'bout police indifference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands CHRIS the roneod leaflet. CHRIS looks it over, is a long and horrific catalogue of attacks. CHRIS takes few copies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. Look, I'll place a few  of these. Did you hear about that murder  in the Park?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASIAN PUNK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, same night I was running these off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS heads down the tube steps, BILLI is still watching  him. The ASIAN PUNK GIRL turns to BILLI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASIAN PUNK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cock on the brain you 'ave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS talks to JILL at reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'yer get his pants off then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks at his watch. He's restless, impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks relieved when TRACY arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for the verdict?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty obvious, ain't it? I mean the  tape wasn't exactly professional...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop worrying Chris. I told him you made  the tape up last night. It's only an  impression he's after. I think I'm  getting somewhere with this club idea...  And, er... can you keep quiet about your  pirate credentials? He's dead set against  that.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's supposed to play our music then?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me. Come on, we'll  be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave Reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and TRACY walk into a studio to find DAVE, a white, middle-aged, middle-class producer, listening to Chris's  voice on tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dave, this is Chris Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As DAVE talks he walks around and leans on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a pew Chris. Yes, well, nice choice  of music, if a bit obscure. But you come  over well. It's just that it's a bit, um  - how shall I say, er - casual. I mean  not everybody will understand what you're  trying to convey. I like it, but the  powers that be... Listen, Chris - to be  honest with you - if we were to take you  on as a presenter - out and about in the  clubs... if we were - and that's a big if  - we'd be looking for a more recognisable  style, something a bit more... um... CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English?  DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... well... I wouldn't put it quite  like that... but... er...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS performs a DJ act, imaginary microphone in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ow 'bout this...... 'bout nah, bringin  the man cal' Jah Fatman singin: Ye can'  keep we down cause we all aroun'... Step  forward yout', come let me tell de  trut'... That do yer? DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's clearly no point in our  continuing. I was merely offering  professional advice, but it's obvious  you're not interested. Tracy, I've got a  programme to do. I'll speak to you later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
