dialogues.text: DAVE leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid arrogant fuck! I went out of  my way to get you in here. Bang goes my idea.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame, innit? The man missed his chance  of signin' up a mega-star.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe this punk,  'no-future' attitude.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no punk. What are yer suggestin'  exactly? Was I supposed to play Elvis  Presley records and sound like Tony  Blackburn? They've gotta realise that I  am your original, your wicked...  Pee-funk-a-del-ic wanna-get-people-all- funked-up-DJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got no idea.... come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY catches CHRIS by the arm and leads him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY leads CHRIS into a cramped office, picks up a  cardboard box and places it on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff Kane, one of the best. Right?...  See this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY looks into the cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His office! This is what he gets for his  five years and the sacks full of fan  mail. He's the only black D.J. in the  whole place, and still he's offered a  contract he has to renew every three  months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY looks round the cramped room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where they'd like to keep him,  keep all of us for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd yer stay if they insult you all the  time?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not gonna run me out that easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cut-out QUEEN waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS walks quickly down the steps that lead into  Reception. He gives the Queen's waving arm a sharp chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges into the Jubilee crown/fountain. Panics the SECURITY GUARDS. But he's out the door before  they can catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cut-out Queen still waves, but more limply now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, hot and restless, wanders the park. Finally he  settles by the pond. Near a YOUNG FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio sounds over: A DJ tells the story of the Sex Pistol recording of 'God Save the Queen', the initial pressing o a thousand copies. A & M's disassociating themselves from the group and the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN re-tunes her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS lays back on the grass, to rest and think things  over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later: CHRIS still stretched out on the grass. TWO  SUNBATHING WOMEN to the side of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man stands menacingly over CHRIS. He looks down on  CHRIS's vulnerable, sleeping form. CHRIS's eyes open,  startled. He looks first at the man, now recognisable as  the plainclothed CID MAN, then at the back-up: TWO

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMEN.
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CID MAN addresses one of the POLICEMEN.  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICEMEN converge on CHRIS, pull him to his feet.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What yer doing....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dragging him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY, the mixed-race skinhead from the estate is let out of the station as CHRIS is led in. KELLY smirks at CHRIS. CHRIS is confused. A POLICEMAN hurries CHRIS into the  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CID Man follows them into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on CHRIS's socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part-way into an interrogation. CHRIS is facing the CID M over a table. Both are seated. The PAR)( POLICEMAN takes  notes. The CID MAN ducks his head down to look at Chris's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of socks are those?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said... What sort of socks are those?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with anything?  PARK POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man wants to know about your socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS bends down, undoes his shoes, pulls off a loud  fluorescent sock and drops it slowly onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen smartarse, no monkey business. You  don't seem to realise, do you? You're not  in here for showing disrespect to Her  Majesty at Metropolitan Radio. No, nor  for running your jungle bunny club on  hallowed grounds, neither.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what yer tellin' me?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know all about yer, that's what. We've  been watching you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is increasingly uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and you might be interested to know  we've heard of your tinpot little radio  station...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This knowledge seems to worry CHRIS more than  anything so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sayin' anything. I'm entitled to  a phone call, right?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell Mum all the news later. But  it's not the radio. And you're not here  for snatchin' some poor dear's handbag.  You're in here for murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is shocked almost to the point of nervous laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON works on the car he worked on before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS does business with KEN. KEN is considering a car, a price sticker is splashed across its windscreen. CAZ polishes the car that interests Ken. CARLTON shouts o to CAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Sweetbwoy! Come over 'ere and 'elp me  wiv dis dam engine. I'm tired an' the man  comin for it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye mad? I ain't going near dat engine.  You mus' want me to nasty up ma garments.  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dam pretty bwoy no wanna help nobody. If  he can drive the motors he should be  prepared to dirty up him clothes too. Man  going like a African prince - or should I  say princess?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off, Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN runs his hand on the bonnet of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take her out for a spin, then talk  prices?  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Ken. No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN approaches CAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What dyer reckon then? Is it worth it?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's nuffin' wrong wiv it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 'ave a word wiv Davis 'bout the price  an' I'll 'elp you out with that gimmick  you're after. CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betta be worth my while, Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN climbs into the car. Drives off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy now, Ken. She fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS boasts to CAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take notice soulhead... Number One  salesman roun' dese parts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON catches the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, ye sell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good as done. Ye no see me 'av the deadly  patter? Deadly! Yeah bwoy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS has lost much of his earlier spark. The questioning is wearing him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna tell us? Where were you the  night before last?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... . I was wiv me mate, makin' up  tapes. Look, I want my phone call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not impressed. 'Wiv me mate'. And do you  think that'll hold? Suppose I tell you  that you were seen, you and your mate, by  the Park that night? Drives a Triumph,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This catches CHRIS off-guard. If he tells them he and CAZ were broadcasting, then it gives the pirate away. Now he  has to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? It's the truth I'm telling ya.  I want my phone call. You ain't got  nothing on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CID MAN opens a cupboard. He takes the badly burnt  cassette recorder out of a plastic bag. He holds it (in  gloved hands) to CHRIS's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen it before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is now totally unnerved, he has handled the recorde but if he says he has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Your kid sister has. She was seen  with it in the Park, before you burnt it,  that is. Panicked did you? Tried to burn  your dirty black paw marks off it, did  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks across to the PARK POLICEMAN, furious at what appears to be a set-up, and furious that Trish has been  involved. He shouts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards. Bastards! What ya doin'  gettin' at a nine year old kid?  CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're calling me a bastard. You'd kill  to get your filthy muggin' hands on a bit  of plastic. Kill one of your own. I say  one of your own, not that you'd see it  that way you being a half-breed, a  mongrel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS can't take it. He screams out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my phone call, my phone call, my  phone call!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS thumps on the table... repeats his demand over and  over... his movements restrained by a POLICEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CID MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went back to find it, didn't you?  Whatever your little sister says. She  stuck up for you, so just who is  involving kids in this? Give the coon his  call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CID MAN lights a cigarette, and casually leaves. A  POLICEMAN places the phone in front of CHRIS and leaves.  CHRIS is left on his own. He picks up the phone, tries a number, mutters 'Caz, Caz' into the receiver. Panic in his voice. There is no reply. He slams down the receiver. Picks it up again and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He half-sings a Metro Radio jingle, to jog his memory. Th jingle incorporates the station's number. He dials the  number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... can I speak to Tracy... no...  no... no I don't know her surname... she  works on the 'In Town Tonight' show. Look,  look, it's urgent, please... Just  use the fuckin' tannoy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause as he waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON is in the garage's rough and ready shower.  Scrubbing off the oil and grease. Slow movements, he's  proud of/enjoys his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN is back from the test drive. Watching CARLTON, but  talking business with DAVIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Davis. Like the motor. Just a  question of the right price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ throws the car's keys to DAVIS. KEN puts his arm round CAZ and walks him away from CARLTO and DAVIS.  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you 'ave a word? I got you that  present. Should do yer nicely.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it when I see it, alright Ken?  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trustin', aren't yer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ continues polishing the car. KEN leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS calls across to CARLTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Carlton, dem say they're lookin' for  a half-caste bwoy now for that murder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN's POV: CARLTON emerges from the shower, drying himsel Kissing his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't trust dem 'alf caste bwoy ye no. Ye  don't know which side them on. I could  well believe it was one a dem kill that  black bwoy.  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man. Dat's what they wan' you to  think. So when the people dem say 'What  you gonna do bout the murdersa?' Babylon  can say, 'Is black a kill black'. I don'  see it.  CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as far as I and I concern, musa be  a white bwoy, an' if it wasn't a white  bwoy. I'll lay on money it was a 'alf  caste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN is back, listening in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I reckon it's an NF job myself...  See yer later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Ya tryin to wind me up  again?... Yeah, it's true it most  probably was a white bwoy kill T.J. But  it could have been a black man. So what  ya sayin? It can't happen? What exactly  you gettin' at Carlton, with all this  'half-caste' crap?  CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, the trouble with you, right can't  always tell what side you're on.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what ya sayin'? What, 'cos Chris is my mate? Or 'cos I mix with white peop...  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN! White MAN!... Nastiness!  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So dat's wot it's about, yeah? I mix with  white man... I fuck with white men!  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ & DAVIS are near to blows. CARLTON intervenes, steeri CAZ away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long as you doin' it to them... innit Caz?  DAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Min' the rod a correction no fuck up dem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ turns on DAVIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fulla shit Davis! The bruwa dat  got killed on the park - he was what you  call an anti-man, a bwatty bwoy. Dat make  it alright now? You concerned 'bout who  did it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS hesitates, he has no quick answer. CAZ throws down his cloth, leaves the garage, not waiting for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY'S POV from cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and a SOLICITOR leave the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY looks across to CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS still looks shaken, surprised at the sudden release He holds his stomach, he has been roughed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been nothin' but trouble Chris.  You screw up at Metro and then you have  the nerve to drag me down here.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastards!... What was I supposed to tell  'em?... Oh, I was pirate broadcasting at  the time, and my best mate hangs about in  parks after dark...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, are you listening to me?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, I'm sorry. Thanks for gettin' the  solicitor for us. Listen, I've got this  tape, right? It was in the beat box.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to give it in, Chris.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Go back in there? You're jokin'.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm no friend of the police, but if  it's evidence you're dealing with, you  don't mess with it.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I just let 'em drag my sister in for  friendly questionin'?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Alright. Forget it. It's none  of my business. Just keep me out of it...  I've got to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks disconsolate and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look pathetic... Come on... I'll drop  you off.  CHRIS climbs into the cab, TRACY pulls the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS plays the Park tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crackly but just audible opening exchange:

dialogues.speaker: VOICES ON TAPE
dialogues.text: WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, aren't yer?  YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ya wanna get to know me?  WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot's yer name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN arrives at the garage.  YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name? You a policeman or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just being friendly, tell us yer name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN crawls through the broken down car that blocks the ba of the garage, the pirate base, to where CHRIS is listeni to the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)  Man, you're one stubborn white boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is startled by KEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris... Brought you something... it's  out the front... Give us a hand, it's a  bit 'eavy... YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)  Terry, friends call me T.J. CHRIS turns off the tape, ejects and pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right wiv yer, Mr Stylee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and CAZ carry a new aerial onto the roof, CHRIS at  the front, CAZ at the back. They negotiate an awkward hat that leads up on to the roof. They're sweating. On the  roof - they clap hands in air. They rest on a ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice as many soul patrollers! Neva  enough for you though, is it? Won't rest  till you're on Radio One!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In BBC accent) This is the BBC Soul Service. Are you  sitting comfortably?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They set to work, laughing at the thought. But CHRIS is  still distracted, tense after the police questioning.  Thinking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What really fucks me in all this is they  were questionin' ma sista! A nine-year  old girl! Is like they're goin' wild. Ye  know wot I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure slackness, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS steps towards a pole, holds the new aerial against  the pole. It's right at the edge of the rooftop. CAZ stan by with a roll of heavy-duty sticking tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly was in there. I mean, what is it?  'Let's Get The Half-Caste Week' or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is still shaky from the interrogation. Dangerously  close to the edge. Suddenly CHRIS slips, hangs over the  side of the tower block. He screams out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tilt down: the dizzying height of the block, the ground f below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS clings to the aerial, CAZ grabs him, carefully pull him back to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were nearly a gonna, man! Right, no  more time up 'ere, let's just do the ting  and get down.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move back from the edge. Finally satisfied with thei handiwork, and relieved it's done, they embrace. They cro the roof to go back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... yeah... Tracy fixed up a meeting  with this producer down Metro. It was her  that got me out of the nick.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? You been crawlin' round  Metro again?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, I've got to get some steady....  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimics Chris)  'Some steady money in'. I got us the  fuckin' aerial, right? You think I like  doing Ken favours? Draggin' me bruwer  into it? Carlton's gonna let a car go  cheap for me and you, ya know...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metro weren't interested, so just forget  it, right?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, I'm just sayin'. We are gettin  through  there's an audience buildin'.  We'll get the advertisin' and we'll 'ave  the money...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you was tryin' your way, I was  tryin' mine. It's the same thing.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted a partner, not your fuckin'  vanity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS suddenly puts his arm round CAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, I am your partner, Caz. We gonna hit  the airwaves, yeah? Funk the Jubilee  special!  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tomorrow. Said I'd play the  concert tomorrow wiv that punk I met -  Billibudd.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't joke about it, Caz.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS jumps back up to the aerial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well smash it down then,  mightn't I? Cos Caz can't be bowered.  He'd sooner go off wiv some BILLEE-BUDD  to play for a bunch of middle class punks  an' hippies - wankers, Caz. Where's your  loyalty man? Where's the fuckin' loyalty  in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the loyalty in you going behin'  ma back, struttin' roun' Metro, prattlin'  bout what we're doin? Ain't you got no  sense? A quick word wiv the Home Office  and they can 'ave a station like ours  wiped out before breakfast... I thought  I was supposed to be your main man?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about? You are ma  main man. I've had a day of it, right? An'  a bit of sympathy might be in order...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cry on Tracy's shoulder...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna smash that thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS turns to the aerial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smash it, you might as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ leaves the roof. CHRIS calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz. I ain't begun to tell yer 'bout what  happened down the nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't got the time, I'm gonna and go  an' see Billi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ leaves the roof, furious. He doesn't hear Chris's  words, or see the Park tape that CHRIS takes out from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz... See this tape, Caz? It's T.J.'s  tape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLIBUDD are out for the night. BILLIBUDD's  daytime politico wear is replaced by a sexier, night-time punk style. He's also wearing black eye make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLI steer a course through a pedestrianised par of central London. There are book and ballet shops,  jewellers and smart hairdressers. Attempts at upmarket  Jubilee displays in many of the windows. CAZ and BILLI drink from cans of imported lager. They're  laughing, exhilarated. BILLIBUDD has something to say to  half the passers-by, his first victim is a WOMAN in  evening dress. BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb the rich! Bomb the rich!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAY CITY ROLLERS fans in full fan regalia roll by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bay City Rollers, why don't yer listen to  some decent music, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ remains a bit detached, part enjoying BILLI's outgoin cheek, part unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bookshop with racks of books on sale outside.  'Gay News' on sale inside. Mary Whitehouse and Anita Brya making the headlines. The shop stocks a mix of respectabl gay novels - Gide, Cocteau, Genet - and old muscle  magazines, like 'Adonis' and 'Body Beautiful'. Collector  gay porn.  Posters for Divine and Nureyev, both on in town.  A MAN BROWSING. BILLIBUDD grabs a book, collars the man. BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Genet, ever read that, 'ave yer? Eh?  Eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI disturbs the book rack, flicks at postcards on  revolving stands. The MAN mutters politely, embarrassed, bit afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... yes .. yes... I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN with a DOG passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look after your bloody dog....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI picks up a book and throws it for CAZ to catch. A  WINDOW-DRESSER stares out from a tasteful array of ballet frocks. He stares at BILLI, BILLI stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you looking at? Piss off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI and CAZ watch the WINDOW-DRESSER complete the  display. He looks distinctly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not only BILLI and CAZ who are watching. THREE  SCOTLAND SUPPORTERS reel in. They're in town for the  England/Scotland match. One of them is shirtless and  kilted. A flag draped over his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI watches the shirtless man. The shirtless Scot sings and chants:  'Scotland, Scotland'... BILLIBUDD raises his arm, clenches his fist. Shows  solidarity with the Scottish cause. BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devloution now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shirtless SUPPORTER steps up to BILLIBUDD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, ye Southern poofter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD lowers his arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO WOMEN pass the shirtless SUPPORTER.  SUPPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gie us a kiss, darlin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other two SUPPORTERS sing and chant anti-English song laugh at the posh shop displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mad, chaotic clash of people and styles, everyone out o the town, enjoying the hot, summer night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD and CAZ arrive at the entrance to a gay club. I is guarded by BOUNCERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLI wait to be let in. A BOUNCER blocks THREE BLACK SOUL BOYS who are trying to  get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOUNCER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look boys. It's gay tonight. Official  policy. No straights. Fuck off.  1st BLACK SOUL BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it out. What you talkin' bout man?  We're gay.  BOUNCER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No membership card. No entry. Simple. 'Op  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO WHITE BOYS pass straight through, no membership cards shown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2nd BLACK SOUL BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let them in...  BOUNCER 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognised their faces.  2nd BLACK SOUL BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And we all look the same, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD waves his card at the BLACK SOUL BOYS and the B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, alright. I've got a card, right... I'm allowed guests, huh?  1st BLACK SOUL BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This club's got some crisp music, man.  All we wanna do is check out the groove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUNCER decides in their favour, but glares at BILLI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOUNCER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. They're in. But if there's any  trouble I'll personally ram that card  down yer throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLACK SOULBOYS head into the disco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shirtless SCOTLAND SUPPORTER staggers down the road,  sees the club. Calls his mates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTLAND SUPPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ere boys, a club!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the bulky BOUNCER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTLAND SUPPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance of a dance, big fella?  BOUNCER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco music reverberates in the corridor. Sylvester: 'You Make Me Feel (Mighty Real)' CAZ and BILLIBUDD walk a litt way into the club.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would we do without ya, Blondie?  Golden tongue, golden hair, golden boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI looks baffled. CAZ ruffles his hair, mock- affectionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parade of clubgoers squeeze past them in the corridor.  The mix of '77 gay style: Brixton radical drag and  neo-hippie, US moustache macho, suburban 'wedge queen'  (geometrically styled haircuts), rent boy and punk. But for all the mix it is almost entirely male and almost entirely white. A GAY GUY eyes Caz up, as he walks past h strokes CAZ's arm, brushes against him. The gay guy's  FRIEND notices...  FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, you are such a dinge queen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD catches the comment and grabs the FRIEND's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi you, fuck off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ takes BILLI's hand off the man. CAZ turns to leave th club. BILLIBUDD follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI takes chewing gum from his mouth. Leaned against th club wall, CAZ and BILLI kiss. A passing STRAIGHT COUPLE look startled by the sight. The MAN mutters, 'disgusting'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm night. The roof lit by safety lamps and the moon.  TRACY breathes in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes me feel like a criminal, sneaking  in here at night!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't doing no harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll wait till the cleaners have gone  from the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS lays his jacket down on a skylight. He sits on his  jacket. TRACY joins him. They looks over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLI in the car. CAZ looks moody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You annoyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've given him a good slap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinkin'... about Soul  Patrol... me and Chris, it ain't workin'.  Told you about him getting nicked today,  didn't I? Well I wasn't exactly  sympathetic. BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, you talk about him a lot. I mean...  what... You two do it, then?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What's it to you? BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing Caz, no. I just want to know,  that's all. You do realise I fancy you,  don't you?... Fancy you a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ quietly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I did sleep with Chris for a  coupla months. His Mum was in hospital at  the time, having Trish, his little  sister. Chris stayed over at my house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD looks a bit dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he is gay then? I thought he was. CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.... we were about ten at the time!  He turned out straight. Sad story really!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLI both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, are you seeing anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm seeing you, ain't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car passes underneath the bridge seen earlier. The NF sign has been spray-canned over with 'Black and White Uni and Fight'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black and white unite and fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI laughs at his own joke. CAZ is only half amused. He raises his eyebrows, as if to ask, what is this man like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY and CHRIS kiss. TRACY unbuttons Chris's shirt. She strokes his chest, pushes the shirt off his shoulders

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her fingers across his crotch. Slowly she moves  astride him, pulling back her long skirt. CHRIS quickly  undoes his flies. CHRIS moans and mutters as they make  love. TRACY is half touched by his words, half laughing. For a  moment she breaks the rhythm.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less of the patter, DJ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow love-making, cries of pleasure. Their shirts ripple the wind.  DISSOLVE TO: later that night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myriad yellow, red and green lights. Almost darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY at the control desk. The Park cassette is in a  machine. CHRIS and TRACY listen, TRACY adjusts controls f optimum sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ya wanna get to know me?  WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot's yer name?  YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name? You a policeman or what?  WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just being friendly, tell us yer name.  YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. you're one stubborn white bwoy. OK -  Terry. Friends call me T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of struggle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the glowing red studio clock.  TRACY switches the machine off.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... There's more... There's more...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game's over, Chris. It is weird, I don't  like it.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' lemme listen again.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if that's what that tape sounds  like, you've got to hand it over.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... I just want to copy it...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... They work fast to copy the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it down 'ere, do yer? Come down 'ere  regular?  YOUNG BLACK MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Later: Close up: CHRIS packages a copy of the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The address on the package:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS seals the flap. TRACY watches. They kiss. CHRIS picks up his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLIBUDD walk near the estate. BILLIBUDD stops a they near area the drive-way into the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are we stoppin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought we'd drop in on the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI reaches into his canvas bag full of leaflets and  newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, thinkin' of doin' a bit of  canvassin' are we? Forget it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course not. Caz. Course not. Just thought  I'd tell a few more people about the  concert, you know? Funk the Jubilee! Caz  at the controls - right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me, Billi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry 'bout it, I'll be a good boy.  I won't be an embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrass yaself as much as you like.  Just leave me out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN in DRAG from the estate JUBILEE party glares at the At evident gayness, at punk versions of the Queen (on  BILLI's shirt), at black and white boy together. He forge the incongruity of his own get-up. CAZ follows BILLI into the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS moves towards the radio base at the back of the  garage. He calls for CAZ. There is no reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a shock he sees a mesh of brown tape curled up round his feet. There is brown tape everywhere. Their every  cassette has been unwound and ruined. Roughly spelt out i cut-up tape - an NF sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shards of broken cassette boxes crack under CHRIS's feet. Yet the records and the equipment are left intact. CHRIS totally unnerved. Nevertheless he climbs through the wrecked car entry to t pirate base. He switches the turntable. He carefully  selects a record, steadying himself. Puts on headphones. He picks up the mike, begins to play Funkadelic: 'One  Nation Under A Groove'. His voice is fragmented, shocked. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'One Nation Under A Groove'... and most  of all right now... we're going out to my  main man, Caz... Funk the Jubilee... Hold  tight... The groove's travellin' on the  park tonight... Main man Caz is gonna  be... funkin' the Jubilee...An' if you  ain't gonna be there... you ain't gonna  be nowhere... I'll see you later Caz...  nuff luv...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song goes on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... this is a chance/this is a chance/ to dance your way/ out of your constrictions/...  With the groove/our only guide/ we shall all be moved...  One nation under a groove/ gettin' down just for the funk of it/ One nation and we're on the move/ Nothin' can stop us now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLIBUDD at the street party, enclosed in the  estate courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The estate has been transformed into a riot of red, white and blue. Flags everywhere. Tables decked out for a meal, stalls selling all manner of Jubilee junk. Children take turns to sit inside a huge gold-sprayed  carriage made of cardboard and crates. They sit in seriou mimicry of royals. A YOUNG BLACK BOY cuts through the crowd on his chopper  bike, riding directly at the carriage. Handlebars fill th screen. He looks set to crash but skids and steers sharpl to avoid it. On the back of the bike - a Union Jack,  blowing in the wind.  Many of the party-goers are in fancy dress, from BEEFEATE to ELVIS PRESLEY. BILLI relishes the sight, can't wait to send it up. He heads for a stall and grabs a Jubilee fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nice. How much is this? Just the  right thing for my 'friend'.  STALLKEEPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yer bleedin' 'ands off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD heads down past a row of stalls, finally pausin at a goldfish stall. Ball in the bowl and you win a  goldfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GOLDFISH STALL MAN struggles to keep control as BILLI pokes at the fish prizes in their polythene bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cruelty to animals. How'd you  like to be stuffed up in a plastic bag?  This your idea of fun, is it? You're sick,  you are. BILLI turns his attention to a MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE, he  proffers a copy of Socialist Worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi... Socialist Worker, right? Stuff the  Jubilee ... the only paper for the  working class... look, we're having a  party down the park, why don't yer come  down, have a look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN pushes BILLI away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just piss off... A GIRL notices the row...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot was that all about, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at BILLI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 INT. GARAGE/RADIO - DAY (continued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of 'Running Away' on the tape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN appears in the background, remarks on the mess. KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... blimey... what 'appened?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now Ken, I'm in the middle of a show,  mate.  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'yer call the police?  CHRIS shakes his head,'No'.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it's no use... no use...  KEN calmly closes in on CHRIS. Suddenly KEN smashes out, pushing CHRIS over the desk...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What yer doin'... ? KEN knocks the tape deck to the floor.  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know wot I want. You fuck me about  and I'll kill yer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN has CHRIS by the throat, he tightens his grip.  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always thought you were so smart, didn't  yer? Well I set you up... I set you up  nicely... CHRIS struggles... KEN's speech is disjointed, a struggle to force the words out...  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when've you fuckin' cared? You  don't understand... you're not like  Caz... Thought I'd kill two birds with  one stone.... But pretty boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN pulls CHRIS round to face him. He grips CHRIS's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pretty boy... You had to stick yer  nose in. Gimme the tape, Chris ...give me  the fucking tape!  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS summons all his force to push KEN off. They fall to the ground fighting.  CHRIS kicks out. Kicks KEN in the face... CHRIS dives through the car at the back of the garage...  runs towards the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN has lost him. KEN wipes his bloodied face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 EXT. ESTATE JUBILEE PARTY - DAY (continued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN, CHRIS's mother, walks through the estate. She's  cornered by an elderly BLUERINSED WHITE WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE RINSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely atmosphere, innit Ann? Remember  what it used to be like round 'ere? When  you could leave your door open an' not  worry 'bout bleeding muggers - or worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I reckon I know what you mean Lil,  reckon I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNGER WOMAN passes by. She greets BLUE RINSE. She  carries a copy of a National Front newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Front News...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN grabs the paper from the startled YOUNGER WOMAN. She  glances across the headlines: 'Hundreds of Thousands Turn Out to Vote National Front!' ANN slowly tears the newspap apart, scatters it on the ground. The YOUNG WOMAN backs  off, angry but a bit afraid of ANN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH and her FRIENDS are nearby.  FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish, there's your Mum...  TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH runs up to ANN. ANN kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, babes? You enjoyin' yerself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH is clutching a small radio. There's a small Union  Jack sticking out of the machine. ANN takes the radio and snaps off the flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, come on, yer don't need that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the flag-free radio back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go over the park, eh? And get some  clean air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Lo Ann. You ain't seen some punk walkin'  about, 'ave ya?  ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not noticed. Wot are you doin 'ere  anyways?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passin' through fast. You goin' over the  Park?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thought we might go for an hour.  Then I thought I might drop round your  Mum's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH tugs at CAZ's waistcoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you 'ear Chris on the radio?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Been on air, 'as he?  TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said about the Park, said you'd be on,  Mr. 'Main Man'.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked about the park?  ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ain't yer workin' wiv 'im today, Caz?  You alright, you and Chris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soul Patrol went dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bloody equipment...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ continues to look for BILLI.  ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch yer later, babes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: BILLIBUDD at a stall run by a PEARLY KING and QUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's all this then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEARLY KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a raffle, and you 'ave to 'ave a  ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raffle. Alright, give us a ticket, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PEARLY QUEEN opens a book of tickets. BILLI mauls the prizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Eights, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI puts down the chocolates and snatches the whole boo of tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'S alright, darling, don't worry, I'll  take the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEARLY KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, oi - where's yer money? BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.. whoa... alright, hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PEARLY QUEEN grabs the book of tickets back. BILLIBUDD reaches into his bag and pulls out a newspaper. Starts his sales patter again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have one of these. Socialist Worker ...  Only paper for the working class... look  - free membership on the back... don't  worry about it ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEARLY KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi you, fuck off out of it and take that  shit wiv yer! BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait... So what's your  problem, eh? What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking across at BILLIBUDD: perched on the rubbish sheds the skins, KELLY, BIGGSY, SPARKY... BILLI continues to aggravate the PEARLY KING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you read this sometime? It  might educate yer.  PEARLY KING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on .. on your way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a beercan is hurled from the sheds, it catches BILLIBUDD across the face. It cuts him just above the eye As BILLI holds his face a conga of Jubilee revellers curl past him. The beercan carrying SKINS jump down to close i on BILLI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ arrives.  SPARKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get yer noo boyfriend 'art of 'ere  Caz, or else 'e might need carryin'...  BILLI is panicked. CAZ more casual about it. He can usual handle SPARKY and Co. He pushes SPARKY and BIGGSY aside,  leads BILLI through the skins. CAZ ignores the taunts, th crushing of cans, the gestures... Safely away, CAZ rounds on BILLI. But at the same time as he shouts he wipes the blood from BILLI'S face, tends him Some of the blood has dripped down onto the t-shirt image of the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid fuckin' wanker. You can't  listen to no-one, can ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only doing my paper round, Caz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're well out of order, Blondie. You're  always shoutin' 'bout imperialism... jus'  look at yaself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD looks bemused.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think if it's there, yer can take it,  don't ya? Ya think you can go where the  fuck ya like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm wiv you Caz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well that depends... dunnit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still playing the park, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty of time for that. Let's get your  face fixed, Blondie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ wipes blood from BILLI's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you keep calling me Blondie? I'm  not even blond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. You're near enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace, head away from the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More flags on a wall, but these are inside, they're rippe and defaced or plastered in punk imagery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi's room is as much a shrine to Punk as the garage is to Reggae - skip furnished, vinyl chairs and dead branche of a tree forming a bed board of sorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI comes into the room, an icepack over the cut on his face, a beer bottle at his mouth. CAZ takes a cigarette.  BILLI puts on X-Ray Spex: 'Identity'. Climbs on the bed,  takes off his studded belt. CAZ laughs at the choice of  music, turns the record off.  BILLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the best idea... Agreed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI climbs off the bed. Kisses CAZ then sorts through h mostly punk records, finally he finds a reggae song. Juni Murvin: 'Police and Thieves'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another kiss. CAZ laughs at the attempt to seduce with  black music, the record goes the same way as the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ow about quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk towards the bed. CAZ takes off BILLI's shirt,  kisses the plaster on his face. Places his cigarette into BILLI's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLI takes off CAZ's shirt. They move to the bed. BILLI  kisses CAZ's chest... and moves down his body. Gulps of beer, drags at the cigarette, undressing... Then the slow thump of serious pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The debris of the Jubilee party. A messy, bleak, near  deserted courtyard. A voice-over from a the Queen's  broadcast.  QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Silver Jubilee of 1935... and at  my Coronation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flags flutter in the wind. The wind's dry metallic sound. CHRIS runs into the estate. Just a few JUBILEE STRAGGLERS are left, a couple heading  drunkenly home, a couple clearing the mess from their  doorsteps. CHRIS kicks a can along the ground.  QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the Empire and the Commonwealth came  to London...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS collides with an abandoned pram... it rolls across  the courtyard. KEN's voice still in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the tape Chris. Give me the  fucking tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the travelling is in both  directions... and  I think we can claim  to be doing our fair share...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks round the estate, searching. Finally he runs  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant sounds of music in the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY and JILL from arrive for the concert, JILL is now  dressed soul-girl style, a total convert. They run into  CAZ and BILLIBUDD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz... You're Caz, aren't you? Chris's  other half, er, DJ spa, right? We never  did get properly introduced at the Club.  Where is he? Have you seen him?  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's my other half. An' you're  Tracy from Metro... I hear they're  letting us in now, one at a time. That's  really metropolitan of 'em...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I don't 'ave  to justify what I do to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY takes in BILLI's 'clean' t-shirt. It features two  cowboys, naked from the waist down....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris was on the air this afternoon. It  seems he got cut off. Metro had any  pirates taken off the air lately, has it?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capitalist crap. Metro Radio.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Billi.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spending twenty pounds on T-shirts from  Vivienne Westwood has got nothing to do  with capitalism, hmmm? BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to do with homoerotica. Nicked  homoerotica, actually. Like it?  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luv it. It's like Anarchy courtesy of  EMI... so rebellious... so St Martin's  School of Art... excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ has to smile at the send-up of BILLI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jill...  JILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ taps BILLI in the stomach, time to move on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS returns to the estate, still searching. Bunting  dropped from a balcony falls across his path. A voice calls out to him.  VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, soulboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS looks up to see SPARKY, KELLY and BIGGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing in on him. CHRIS walks straight up to KELLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot was they askin' yer down the nick?  KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted an 'alf caste. Told 'em they musta  got the wrong one.  SPARKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear, I forgot to wear me white suit. CHRIS looks him up and down: the shaved head, Union Jack  t-shirt, the patriotic skinstyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look pretty white to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Don't know why you're laughin',  Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly laughs at anythin','cos he knows nothin'. And as long as he knows nothin',  he can make out he's whi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY shouts to drown the word 'white'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't nothing to me, it's only yerself  yer connin'. SPARKY smiles, enjoys CHRIS and KELLY arguing it out  amongst themselves. CHRIS knows SPARKY would relish a  fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead CHRIS walks up to KELLY, he grabs him, pulls him  close. CHRIS is too angry to be worried by any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you lying and hidin' all the time,  Kelly? They were pissing about wiv us  down at the station. Ken killed T.J. and  tried to pin it on us. You listenin'?  Have you seen Ken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't seen him, Chris. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS lets go of KELLY, KELLY stumbles backwards. SPARKY crashes a milk bottle to the ground, it smashes  close to CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS starts to scream out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz. Where are you Caz?... Where are you? ... Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SKINS are confused and angered by Chris's behaviour,  there's none of the usual banter. Neighbours come out of  their doors, look down from their balconies. So many eyes on them, the gang can't risk a fight. CHRIS keeps calling for Caz. Even SPARKY is unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS runs into the Park. He pushes through punks and hippy-types. Still shouting.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are heaps of banners and placards round the edge of the Park. Emblems of the Socialist Workers' Party, labour groups and trades' councils, mixed with the punkier  graphics of the Anti-Nazi League. A sharp contrast to the Estate Jubilee decorations. CHRIS stumbles through the  placards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, a stage. A 'Fuck The Jubilee' banner  emblazoned across it. A short way from the main crowd,  CHRIS spots TRACY and JILL. JILL is dancing with TWO BLAC WOMEN. Live music from an Asian band fills the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY catches sight of CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Chris... Chris!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS calls out to TRACY, TRACY leaves the WOMEN to reach him. A blur of extraordinary images, seen selectively, in fragments, through Chris's anxious eyes. The 'Fuck the  Jubilee' is as much a pageant as the Jubilee itself. Peop are decked out in masks, in parodies of Jubilee costumes. CHRIS pushes past the ASIAN GIRL PUNK, seen earlier with  Billibudd leafleting the tube. She is dressed as Britanni with spear and shield - an outfit to offend just about  everybody.  The ASIAN PUNK GIRL's friends wear satiric and grotesque  masks - of Callaghan, Steel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others wear clothes featuring distorted images of the Roy Family. A small group wear cardboard corgi masks. Finally TRACY reaches CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS grabs hold of her arms. A panic in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken did it... it was Ken... Listen...  something's gonna happen. I've gotta find  Caz...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssshhh... Slow down, Chris. Slow down.  What are you talking about, who's Ken?  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just help me find him...  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Chris. No more. We're going. Have you  seen all the police? Vans loads of 'em,  all round the park. I don't like the look  of it...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS grabs TRACY, she sees all the fear in him and  follows. They head for the stage...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The stage. An Asian band pack away their instruments,  unaware of the growing chaos round the edges of the park. They move to leave the stage for CAZ and BILLIBUDD to kee the disco going between acts. The stage is stacked with  large, heavy speakers. Drum kits and electrical equipment CAZ steps up to the turntable, puts on a record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKY and BIGGSY converge round the edge of the Park.  They mix with a group of older men - many of them seen  earlier in fancy-dress on the estate. A BEEFEATER, A  POLICEMAN amongst them. Whether the policeman is real or  not it's impossible to tell. The costumes make convenient masks. The men hand round bulging plastic bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and TRACY in the crowd. SKINS steam into the  crowd... kicking people to the ground... CHRIS gets  pushed... he loses TRACY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off!... Tracy!... Tracy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surrounding fights get more vicious. People, especially people with young children, are  beginning to panic...  Gangs of NF thugs pick out the armbands of the Anti-Nazi  League stewards, and move in to attack any who are on the own. Some of the Anti-Jubilee revellers run to the  stewards' assistance. The CID MAN from the police station is in the crowd,  watching, not moving to anyone's assistance. A man wearing a BEEFEATER costume lights a petrol bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLIBUDD survey the growing chaos from the stage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A petrol bomb, seen close, pulled from a carrier bag... i hurtles through the air... a streak of light against a  darkening sky.  The bomb hits the stage... starting a fire. BILLI jumps down, CAZ tries to save the records, but in t middle of increasing chaos, some of the records spill ont the mud.  Roll over the ground.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Billi... the records ... They have to make a run for it. The stage banner is in  flames. Floodlights crash down on the crowd ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN runs into the Park. Pushes through the crowd. People  are running to get out.  ANN tries to reach the Park gates with TRISH. KEN bangs into ANN and TRISH, he knocks TRISH to the grou ANN yells after him as she picks TRISH up.  ANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out... Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses TRISH, protects her as they move to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're surrounded by PUNKS and TEDS, PUNKS in anti-Nazi  t-shirts, others in confusing swastikas...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: YEOMEN of the GUARD, BEEFEATERS, HENRY VIII, SIR WALTER  RALEIGH, a group of heavily disguised men who work their  way systematically towards the stage.  Screams and chaos. Some of the Anti-Jubilee crowd tear at the flags and  costumes of the Jubilee revellers. Carnival attacks  Carnival. The police wade into selective Anti-Jubilee  targets.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CHRIS nears the stage. KEN in pursuit. Smoke billows up, CHRIS can't see whether CAZ is still  there.  SPARKY and BIGGS fall about laughing at the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CHRIS reaches the stage, only to find CAZ gone. He climbs through flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes the Park cassette out of his back pocket. Screams  into the microphone. The chill sound of KEN and T.J. in t opening scene, now broadcast across the Park.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're here. Hear it!

dialogues.speaker: VOICES ON TAPE
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So leggo ma han'... I ain't into no rough  stuff, right? KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, aren't yer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ and BILLIBUDD hear the tape... CAZ suddenly recognise the first voice.  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICES ON TAPE (cntd):  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ya wanna get to know me? What's yer  name? T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name? You a policeman or what? CAZ recognises the other voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken! KEN reaches the stage. Pushes and crawls through burning  speakers to get to the tape deck. To stop the tape.  VOICES ON TAPE (cntd):  KEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just being friendly, tell us yer name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you're one stubborn white bwoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS raises his arms to shield his face from the flames. He sees KEN coming towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEN tries to protect himself with his jacket hood.  Suddenly part of the stage gives way under him. He  disappears in flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS manages to jump off the stage just before the whole structure goes up in flame. Screams from the crowd....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from the stage area, the Park is emptying, quietenin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL cries. TRACY holds her, steadies her. But there's also rage on TRACY'S face. Rage at the  destruction.  CHRIS finds them...  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not far away from CHRIS and TRACY, CAZ has covered his  ears in horror. BILLIBUDD touches CAZ's face. BILLI tries to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright... CAZ and CHRIS finally see each other...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris... Chris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS leaves TRACY.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. I'll be back. CHRIS and CAZ step towards each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz, thank Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLIBUDD watches the meeting of CAZ and CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across rooftops. Night sky. The garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towards dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL and BILLIBUDD gently clean the mud off records rescu from the Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've set up a kind of record repair production line.  TRACY takes the polished records, passes them onto CHRIS  and CAZ at the turntable. CAZ and CHRIS test the records  for playability, for scratches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS turns to CAZ.  CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't runnin' from yer, Caz. We're  okay now, yeah? Soul Patrol again...  CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's start over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands, then hold each other in a warm embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The records continue to pass from hand to hand... JILL  steps out of the line to dance... TRACY joins JILL in the dance. BILLIBUDD leaves the records to dance with TRACY and JILL CAZ moves from the turntable to join the dance...  CHRIS joins them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Earland: 'Let The Music Play'.  The laughter and the dance continue over:
